tool.name: attribute_eo

param.name: in_ProcFeats
param.dialogReference:
Input polygon feature class with "site-worthy" Procedural Features relevant to a particular site type.

For this tool to work, this feature class must have the following fields:

  • SF_EOID

  • ELCODE

  • SNAME

Example inputs:

  • pfTerrestrial

  • pfStream

  • pfKarst

NOTE: This should have been generated by the "Extract Biotics data" tool, followed by the "Parse site types" tool.

param.name: in_elExclude
param.dialogReference:
Input table containing list of elements to be excluded from the process.

NOTE: This list should be updated at least once annually. The "Create Element Exclusion List" tool is used to compile the CSV files from different biologists into a single geodatabase table named "ElementExclusions".

param.name: in_consLands
param.dialogReference:
Input polygon feature class representing conservation lands (managed areas).

For this tool to work, this table must have the following fields:

  • MATYPE

  • BMI

NOTE: This dataset should be requested from the Natural Heritage Conservation Lands GIS Planner.

param.name: in_consLands_flat
param.dialogReference:
A "flattened" version of the input conservation lands feature class, based on level of Biodiversity Management Intent (BMI). (This is needed due to overlapping polygons in the database).

For this tool to work, this table must have the following field:

  • BMI

NOTE: This should have been generated by the "Flatten Conservation Lands" tool.

param.name: in_ecoReg
param.dialogReference:
Input polygon feature class representing ecoregions.

Example: tncEcoRegions_lam

param.name: fld_RegCode
param.dialogReference:
Field in the ecoregions feature class containing with short region codes.

Example: GEN_REG

param.name: cutYear
param.dialogReference:
Integer value indicating hard cutoff year. EOs with last observation year equal to or earlier than this cutoff are to be excluded from the ECS process altogether.

  • For terrestrial and stream sites, this should be 25 years prior to the current year.

  • For karst sites, this should be 40 years prior to the current year.

Examples: If the current year is 2020 and you are working on terrestrial or stream sites, enter the value 1995. If the current year is 2020 and you are working on karst sites, enter the value 1980.

param.name: flagYear
param.dialogReference:
Integer value indicating flag year. EOs with last obs equal to or earlier than this cutoff are to be flagged with "Update Needed". However, this cutoff does not affect the ECS process.

  • For terrestrial and stream sites, this should be 20 years prior to the current year.

  • For karst sites, this should be 35 years prior to the current year.

Examples: If the current year is 2020 and you are working on terrestrial or stream sites, enter the value 2000. If the current year is 2020 and you are working on karst sites, enter the value 1985.

param.name: out_procEOs
param.dialogReference:
Output feature class containing Element Occurrences from which non-site-worthy Procedural Features have been removed. Includes several added attributes needed for prioritization.

For EOs not excluded from the prioritization process, initial conservation priority is designated in the TIER field as one of the following:

  • Irreplaceable

  • Critical

  • Choice

param.name: out_sumTab
param.dialogReference: Output table summarizing the number of Element Occurrences per element to be included in the prioritization process.

tool.summary:
Attaches various attributes to the site-worthy portions of Element Occurrences (EOs), creating a new output feature class as well as a summary table.

The outputs from this tool are required as inputs to the "Score Element Occurrences" and "Build Conservation Portfolio" tools.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Attaches various attributes to the site-worthy portions of Element Occurrences (EOs), creating a new output feature class as well as a summary table.

The outputs from this tool are required as inputs to the "Score Element Occurrences" and "Build Conservation Portfolio" tools.
